quizName: AB-900: Microsoft 365 Copilot & Agent Administration Fundamentals Practice Exam (Shuffled)

questions.Question: Which Microsoft 365 service primarily provides email, calendar, and contact functionality for users?

Options.reason: Incorrect. SharePoint is mainly used for sites and document libraries.
Incorrect. Teams focuses on chat and collaboration.
Correct. Exchange Online provides cloud-based email, calendar, and contacts.
Incorrect. OneDrive is for personal file storage.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Exchange Online is the cloud-based email and calendaring service in Microsoft 365 that hosts user mailboxes.

questions.Question: You need to configure Conditional Access policies and enforce multi-factor authentication for users. Which admin portal should you use?

Options.reason: Correct. Conditional Access and MFA policies are configured here.
Incorrect. This portal manages tenants and licenses but not Conditional Access.
Incorrect. This manages Teams policies, not identity sign-in policies.
Incorrect. Purview focuses on data protection and compliance.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Conditional Access and MFA enforcement are identity and access features managed in the Microsoft Entra admin center.

questions.Question: Which statement best describes the Zero Trust security model used in Microsoft 365?

Options.text: Access is granted based on device location only, ignoring user identity and risk.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Zero Trust considers multiple signals.

Options.text: Users on the corporate network are always trusted.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Zero Trust does not inherently trust any network location.

Options.text: Once a user signs in successfully, they are trusted on all devices.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Zero Trust assumes continuous verification is required.

Options.text: "Never trust, always verify" with continuous validation of user, device, and risk.
Options.reason: Correct. Zero Trust emphasizes continuous verification for every request.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Zero Trust in Microsoft 365 follows the "never trust, always verify" principle.

questions.Question: Your organization wants to automatically classify files as 'Confidential' and apply encryption when they contain sensitive information. Which feature should you use?

Options.reason: Incorrect. eDiscovery is used for legal investigations.
Correct. Sensitivity labels classify and protect content with encryption.
Incorrect. Retention labels control how long content is kept.
Incorrect. Defender XDR focuses on threat response.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Sensitivity labels in Microsoft Purview can classify content and apply protection such as encryption.

questions.Question: Which scenario is the best fit for a Data Loss Prevention (DLP) policy in Microsoft 365?

Options.text: Preventing users from sending emails with credit card numbers to external recipients.
Options.reason: Correct. DLP policies restrict sharing of sensitive information.
Incorrect. This is handled through retention policies.
Incorrect. This is configured in the Teams admin center.

Options.text: Resetting user passwords after a phishing attack.
Options.reason: Incorrect. This is an identity operation.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: DLP policies are designed to detect and protect sensitive information from leaving the organization.

questions.Question: How does Microsoft 365 Copilot determine which organizational data it can use when generating a response for a user?

Options.text: It has unrestricted access to all content stored in the tenant.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Copilot does not bypass permissions.

Options.text: It reads all content labeled as 'Confidential' regardless of permissions.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Sensitivity labels and permissions still control access.

Options.text: It uses the user’s existing permissions in Microsoft Graph to access only allowed content.
Options.reason: Correct. Copilot respects user permissions via Microsoft Graph.

Options.text: It only uses public internet data.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Copilot uses data from Microsoft Graph when permitted.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot enforces the user’s existing permissions, accessing only data the user is authorized to view.

questions.Question: Your organization wants to start using Microsoft 365 Copilot for a small pilot group and pay based on usage rather than per user. Which licensing approach should you consider?

Options.reason: Incorrect. E3 alone does not provide Copilot capabilities.

Options.text: Enabling Copilot in the Microsoft Defender portal.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Defender is for security, not licensing.

Options.text: Creating a new tenant solely for Copilot.
Options.reason: Incorrect. This does not avoid licensing costs.

Options.text: Using Copilot pay-as-you-go billing linked to an Azure subscription.
Options.reason: Correct. This allows payment based on consumption.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot pay-as-you-go billing uses an Azure subscription to meter usage, suited for pilot scenarios.

questions.Question: As a Microsoft 365 administrator, how can you best monitor adoption of Microsoft 365 Copilot in your organization?

Options.text: Review Copilot usage analytics and reports in the Microsoft 365 admin center.
Options.reason: Correct. Admin reports show how users are adopting Copilot.

Options.text: Ask each user to email weekly summaries.
Options.reason: Incorrect. This is manual and inefficient.

Options.text: Check the Microsoft Store download statistics.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Copilot is integrated, not a separate Store app.

Options.text: Run a full eDiscovery search across all prompts.
Options.reason: Incorrect. eDiscovery is for legal matters.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot usage and adoption are monitored through built-in analytics available to administrators.

questions.Question: Which statement best differentiates an agent from the core Microsoft 365 Copilot experience?

Options.text: Agents are always created automatically when Copilot is enabled.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Agents must be explicitly created.

Options.text: Agents replace the need for Copilot in Word and Excel.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Agents complement the core experience.

Options.text: Agents are specialized AI entities tailored to specific tasks or business processes.
Options.reason: Correct. Agents are scenario-focused assistants.

Options.text: Agents can only run outside Microsoft 365.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Agents can integrate with Microsoft 365 data.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Agents are custom, scenario-specific AI assistants, often built in Copilot Studio.

questions.Question: You have created a new Copilot agent for HR FAQs using Microsoft Copilot Studio. Which set of steps represents a typical basic administration lifecycle for this agent?

Options.text: Create the agent, assign Global admin role to it, and enable anonymous access.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Anonymous access is risky for HR data.

Options.text: Create the agent, configure topics, test in a safe environment, publish to a pilot group, and monitor usage.
Options.reason: Correct. This reflects a controlled lifecycle.

Options.text: Create the agent, immediately publish it to all users, and disable logging.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Skips testing and governance.

Options.text: Create the agent, remove all data connections, and schedule it to delete itself.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Not a useful production lifecycle.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: A sound agent lifecycle includes configuration, testing, limited pilot release, and ongoing monitoring.

questions.Question: Which Microsoft 365 service is primarily used to host team sites and document libraries for collaboration within departments or projects?

Options.reason: Incorrect. OneDrive is for personal storage.
Incorrect. Teams is a hub but uses SharePoint for file storage.
Incorrect. Exchange is for email.
Correct. SharePoint hosts team sites and document libraries.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: SharePoint in Microsoft 365 hosts team sites and document libraries for collaboration.

questions.Question: Which task is most appropriate to perform in the Microsoft 365 admin center?

Options.text: Creating users and assigning product licenses
Options.reason: Correct. This is the primary portal for user management.

Options.text: Creating a new Conditional Access policy
Options.reason: Incorrect. This is done in the Entra admin center.

Options.text: Configuring a DLP policy for credit card data
Options.reason: Incorrect. This is done in the Purview portal.

Options.text: Creating a new Copilot agent in Copilot Studio
Options.reason: Incorrect. This is done in Copilot Studio.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: The Microsoft 365 admin center is the primary portal for managing users and licenses.

questions.Question: Which capability is provided by Microsoft Entra ID for securing user sign-ins to Microsoft 365?

Options.reason: Incorrect. These are for data classification.
Correct. MFA is an Entra ID feature for secure sign-ins.
Incorrect. This is for legal search.
Incorrect. These are for data lifecycles.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Microsoft Entra ID provides MFA as a core identity protection mechanism.

questions.Question: You want a helpdesk technician to reset user passwords without granting broad administrative privileges. Which approach should you use?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Violates least-privilege.
Incorrect. Focuses on security tools, not user management.
Correct. Can reset passwords and manage users.
Incorrect. Admins still need permissions for assisted resets.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: The User Administrator role allows password resets while avoiding full tenant control.

questions.Question: Which feature is designed to protect users from malicious links and attachments in email and Microsoft 365 workloads?

Options.reason: Correct. Provides Safe Links and Safe Attachments.
Incorrect. Focuses on retention.
Incorrect. Focuses on productivity analytics.
Incorrect. Used for building AI agents.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Microsoft Defender for Office 365 protects against malicious links and attachments.

questions.Question: Which Microsoft Purview capability helps you identify and manage risky user behavior such as potential data exfiltration?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Monitors messages for policy violations.
Correct. Detects and acts on risky internal user activities.
Incorrect. Focused on legal case management.
Incorrect. Governs data retention.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Microsoft Purview Insider Risk Management analyzes activity to detect risky behavior like data leakage.

questions.Question: Your organization must retain project documents for seven years and then delete them automatically. Which feature should you use?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Focuses on protection, not duration.
Incorrect. Relates to threat detection.
Correct. Allows retaining and then deleting content automatically.
Incorrect. Controls chat behavior.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Retention labels and policies enable retention and deletion schedules for content.

questions.Question: Which is a typical use case for Microsoft 365 Copilot in Word?

Options.text: Drafting a proposal by summarizing relevant emails and documents
Options.reason: Correct. Copilot generates content based on accessible data.
Incorrect. Handled by update management tools.
Incorrect. Done in the Entra portal.
Incorrect. Done in the Exchange admin center.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot in Word can generate and refine documents using content the user can access.

questions.Question: Which statement accurately describes how Microsoft 365 Copilot respects data protection in Microsoft 365?

Options.text: Copilot can access any document in the tenant.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Constrained by user permissions.

Options.text: Copilot uses existing permissions, sensitivity labels, and governance controls.
Options.reason: Correct. Adheres to the security and compliance model.

Options.text: Copilot can only access content stored on the user’s device.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Accesses cloud resources via Graph.
Incorrect. Labels are respected.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Microsoft 365 Copilot respects user permissions and labels when retrieving data.

questions.Question: Which prerequisite is typically required before assigning Microsoft 365 Copilot licenses to users?

Options.text: Users must be assigned the Global Administrator role.
Options.reason: Incorrect. End users do not need admin roles.

Options.text: Users must be excluded from all Purview policies.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Policies can coexist.

Options.text: Users must have a compatible Microsoft 365 base license (e.g., E3 or E5).
Options.reason: Correct. Copilot is sold as an add-on.

Options.text: Users must have a separate tenant.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Used within the existing tenant.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Microsoft 365 Copilot requires underlying eligible Microsoft 365 base licenses.

questions.Question: What is a key characteristic of Microsoft 365 Copilot pay-as-you-go billing?

Options.text: It requires an on-premises license server.
Options.reason: Incorrect. It is a cloud service.

Options.text: It bills usage against an associated Azure subscription based on consumption.
Options.reason: Correct. Ties usage to metered Azure billing.

Options.text: It eliminates the need for base licenses.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Base licenses are still required.

Options.text: It is only for tenants with over 10,000 users.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Size is not the defining characteristic.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: In the pay-as-you-go model, usage is metered and billed through an Azure subscription.

questions.Question: Which action best supports successful adoption of Microsoft 365 Copilot in an organization?

Options.text: Enabling Copilot for all users at once without training.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Can lead to confusion.

Options.text: Disabling access to all admin reports.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Reports provide insight.

Options.text: Running a pilot with a selected group, providing training, and reviewing usage reports.
Options.reason: Correct. A structured pilot is best practice.

Options.text: Allowing only Global Administrators to use Copilot.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Intended for broad productivity.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Piloting Copilot with training and monitoring analytics supports effective adoption.

questions.Question: Which measure best aligns with prompt governance for Microsoft 365 Copilot?

Options.text: Establishing acceptable-use guidelines and educating users.
Options.reason: Correct. Education is central to governance.
Incorrect. Governance aims for responsible use, not a ban.
Incorrect. Conflicts with identity governance.
Incorrect. Policies are important for compliance.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Prompt governance involves defining acceptable use and educating users.

questions.Question: Which description best defines an agent in the context of Microsoft 365 Copilot and agents?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Not a Copilot agent.
Incorrect. Not what agents refer to.

Options.text: A specialized AI assistant tailored to specific tasks or business processes.
Options.reason: Correct. Agents are scenario-specific.
Incorrect. This refers to security.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Agents are AI-powered entities focused on specific business scenarios.

questions.Question: You created an IT helpdesk agent in Microsoft Copilot Studio. Where can you typically deploy this agent so users can interact with it?

Options.text: Microsoft Teams and web chat experiences
Options.reason: Correct. Agents can be deployed to Teams and web chat.
Incorrect. Not deployed at firmware level.
Incorrect. Admin center is for administration.

Options.text: Only as a browser extension for Microsoft Edge.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Uses channels like Teams.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Copilot agents are commonly deployed in channels such as Microsoft Teams and web chat.

questions.Question: When designing a Copilot agent that answers HR policy questions, what is the most important data access consideration?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Must respect governance.

Options.text: Connecting the agent only to public internet data.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Internal content is usually more useful.
Incorrect. Monitoring is important.

Options.text: Connecting the agent to appropriate HR sites that enforce Microsoft 365 permissions.
Options.reason: Correct. Relies on secured and governed data.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Agents should use governed internal sources while respecting Microsoft 365 permissions.

questions.Question: Which step is typically part of a governed lifecycle for Copilot agents?

Options.text: Allowing any user to publish without review.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Governance requires approval.

Options.text: Documenting the agent’s purpose, sources, and owner, and reviewing usage.
Options.reason: Correct. Includes documentation and review.
Incorrect. Analytics support monitoring.
Incorrect. Agents should be updated as needed.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Good governance includes documenting agents and reviewing their usage over time.

questions.Question: Which admin center is primarily used to configure DLP policies and sensitivity labels?

Options.reason: Incorrect. It links to Purview but doesn't host the configuration.
Incorrect. Focuses on identity.
Correct. Used for DLP and labels.
Incorrect. Manages Teams settings.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: DLP policies and sensitivity labels are configured in the Microsoft Purview portal.

questions.Question: Where are files shared in a standard channel in Microsoft Teams typically stored?

Options.text: In the user’s local Downloads folder.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Uses cloud storage.

Options.text: In a SharePoint site associated with the team.
Options.reason: Correct. Files are stored in the team's SharePoint library.
Incorrect. Not used for Teams files.
Incorrect. Not the default store for channel files.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Teams standard channel files are stored in the underlying SharePoint site’s document library.

questions.Question: What is a primary consideration when enabling guest access in Microsoft 365 for collaboration with external partners?

Options.text: Guests automatically receive Global Admin privileges.
Options.reason: Incorrect. No admin roles by default.

Options.text: Guest access is only possible if Copilot is disabled.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Unrelated.

Options.text: Guest access should be governed with policies that control sharing and access reviews.
Options.reason: Correct. Governance ensures appropriate access levels.

Options.text: Guests must be given a dedicated tenant.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Use B2B features.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Guest access should be controlled with governance policies and access reviews.

questions.Question: Why is it important to address oversharing in SharePoint and OneDrive before enabling Copilot broadly?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Does not change permissions.

Options.text: Copilot may surface content that users have access to but should not realistically see.
Options.reason: Correct. Oversharing is exposed by AI queries.

Options.text: Copilot only works with public content.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Respects (overshared) permissions.
Incorrect. Influences what AI surfaces.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: If files are overshared, Copilot can surface that data to the wrong people, making cleanup essential.

questions.Question: Which description best matches Microsoft 365 as a product?

Options.text: A cloud-based suite of productivity, collaboration, and security services.
Options.reason: Correct. Combines apps, collaboration, and security.

Options.text: A standalone desktop suite that runs only on Windows.
Options.reason: Incorrect. It is cloud-based.

Options.text: A collection of on-premises server products.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Servers are different from the M365 subscription.
Incorrect. Primarily for end-user productivity.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Microsoft 365 is a cloud-based subscription integrating productivity and security tools.

questions.Question: Which task would you typically perform in the Exchange admin center?

Options.text: Creating a new shared mailbox for the finance department.
Options.reason: Correct. Mailboxes are managed here.
Incorrect. Done in Copilot Studio.
Incorrect. Done in Purview.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: The Exchange admin center is used to manage mailboxes and mail flow.

questions.Question: You need to restrict which users can schedule live events in Microsoft Teams. Which admin center should you use?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Links to it but doesn't host the policy.
Incorrect. Manages identity.
Incorrect. Manages compliance.
Correct. Central place for Teams policies.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: The Teams admin center is the central place to configure Teams-specific policies.

questions.Question: Which combination of features most directly supports the Zero Trust model in Microsoft 365?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Helps with governance but not access control.

Options.text: MFA, Conditional Access, and device compliance policies.
Options.reason: Correct. Enforces continuous verification.
Incorrect. collaboration features.

Options.text: Mail flow rules and automatic replies.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Email features.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: MFA, Conditional Access, and device compliance policies are central to Zero Trust.

questions.Question: What is a primary purpose of Microsoft Defender XDR in a Microsoft 365 environment?

Options.text: To provide a unified experience for detecting and responding to threats across domains.
Options.reason: Correct. Correlates signals to manage threats.
Incorrect. Handled in M365 admin center.
Incorrect. Handled in Outlook/Teams.
Incorrect. Handled in SharePoint.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Microsoft Defender XDR aggregates security signals and enables investigation across workloads.

questions.Question: When would you typically use Microsoft Purview eDiscovery (Standard)?

Options.text: To create a chat-based Copilot agent.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Done in Copilot Studio.

Options.text: To search and preserve content for a legal investigation.
Options.reason: Correct. Designed for legal and compliance search.
Incorrect. Done by sensitivity labels.
Incorrect. Done in Entra or M365 admin center.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: eDiscovery is used to search, preserve, and export content for legal investigations.

questions.Question: Which behavior can sensitivity labels enforce on documents and emails?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Labels don't perform migrations.
Incorrect. Labels don't schedule meetings.
Correct. Can apply encryption and access rules.
Incorrect. Licensing is independent.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Sensitivity labels can automatically encrypt content and control access.

questions.Question: Which action can a Data Loss Prevention (DLP) policy perform when it detects sensitive information in an outbound email?

Options.text: Block the email or show a policy tip that warns the user.
Options.reason: Correct. Can block, warn, or allow overrides.
Incorrect. DLP doesn't delete mailboxes.
Incorrect. Not a DLP action.
Incorrect. DLP is not for license management.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: DLP policies can block messages, log events, and display policy tips.

questions.Question: What is a key distinction between Microsoft 365 Copilot and using a public, consumer AI chatbot?

Options.reason: Incorrect. It is a cloud service.

Options.text: Copilot integrates with Microsoft Graph and respects enterprise permissions.
Options.reason: Correct. Honors existing governance.

Options.text: Copilot only answers questions about public web content.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Uses organizational content.

Options.text: Copilot is limited to a single app.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Integrated across Word, Excel, etc.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Microsoft 365 Copilot uses Microsoft Graph and respects enterprise security controls.

questions.Question: Which task is an example of a basic administrative responsibility for Microsoft 365 Copilot?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Managed by Microsoft.

Options.text: Manually reviewing every prompt in real time.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Not practical.

Options.text: Assigning Copilot licenses to users and monitoring usage analytics.
Options.reason: Correct. Admins manage licensing and monitoring.
Incorrect. Provided by M365 updates.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Admins are responsible for assigning Copilot licenses and monitoring usage reports.

questions.Question: Which capability is part of managing prompts for Microsoft 365 Copilot according to the AB-900 skills outline?

Options.reason: Incorrect. Prompts are inputs.

Options.reason: Correct. Can manage stored prompts for reuse.

Options.text: Running prompts only from the admin center.

Options.text: Requiring Global Admin approval for each prompt.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Not a standard feature.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: The AB-900 outline includes managing prompts such as saving, sharing, and deleting them.

questions.Question: You published a Copilot agent for the finance team. How should you restrict access so that only finance staff can use it?

Options.text: Assign the agent to the Global Administrator role.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Agents don't receive roles.
Incorrect. Undermines security.

Options.text: Share the agent only with a Microsoft 365 group containing finance users.
Options.reason: Correct. Restricts access by group membership.
Incorrect. Doesn't enforce restriction.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Agents should be shared with specific security or Microsoft 365 groups.

questions.Question: Which practice best aligns with a good approval process for Copilot agents?

Options.text: Publishing agents directly to all users without review.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Introduces risks.

Options.text: Requiring review by security stakeholders for agents accessing sensitive data.
Options.reason: Correct. Formal approval is needed for sensitive data.
Incorrect. Agents should be updated.

Options.text: Allowing only end users to approve their own agents.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Requires central oversight.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Agents using sensitive data should follow a formal approval process involving security stakeholders.

questions.Question: Which combination of activities best represents ongoing monitoring and lifecycle management for Copilot agents?

Options.text: Create the agent once, never change it.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Agents should be updated.

Options.text: Limit monitoring to license counts only.
Options.reason: Incorrect. Usage insights are important.
Incorrect. Disrupts business.

Options.text: Track usage and performance, gather feedback, and update or retire the agent as needed.
Options.reason: Correct. Lifecycle management includes monitoring and retirement.

questions.CorrectAnswerExplanation: Lifecycle management includes monitoring via analytics and managing updates or retirement.
